#summary your first specification start here!

  # declare a Specification object
{{{
import scala.specs._

object myGreatSpecification extends Specification {

}
}}}
  # add a description for your system to specify:
{{{
import scala.specs._

object myGreatSpecification extends Specification {
  "This wonderful system" should {
  }
}
}}}
  # add one example of what your system is supposed to do:
{{{
import scala.specs._

object myGreatSpecification extends Specification {
  "This wonderful system" should {
    "save the world" in {
    }
  }
}
}}}
  # back-up your example with assertions:
{{{
import scala.specs._
import MySystem._

object myGreatSpecification extends Specification {
  "This wonderful system" should {
    "save the world" in {
      val world = new World
      save(world) 
      word.wars must beEmpty
    }
  }
}
}}}
   # add a runner object to execute your specification
{{{
import scala.specs._
import MySystem._
import scala.specs.runner.JUnit3

object myGreatSpecificationRunner extends JUnit3(myGreatSpecification)
object myGreatSpecification extends Specification {
  "This wonderful system" should {
    "save the world" in {
      val world = new World
      save(world) 
      word.wars must beEmpty
    }
  }
}
}}}
  # compile and run the class named *myGreatSpecificationRunner$* with your favorite JUnit  runner (let's say [http://farm2.static.flickr.com/1098/1433239972_5f3a83e40c.jpg?v=0  Eclipse])
